entry.title: [RFC] Canonical input and output ordering in transactions
entry.summary: In an email exchange between Mark Friedenbach and Rusty Russell, Friedenbach raises concerns about the use of randomization in SIGHASH_SINGLE which is used in assurance contracts. Russell proposes an alternative to randomization but Friedenbach argues that unconstrained randomization cannot be used either. However, both agree that moving towards verifiable, deterministic methods where possible is a positive step. The conversation ends with a response from Wladimir.
